verses.kjv: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: These are the words of the Teacher, a descendant of David, who ruled as king in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.
verses.ct: "Absolutely meaningless!" says the Teacher. "Absolutely meaningless! Everything is meaningless."

verses.kjv: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?
verses.ct: What does anyone actually gain from all the hard work they put in during their life?

verses.kjv: One generation passeth away, and another generation cometh: but the earth abideth for ever.
verses.ct: One generation dies off and the next one arrives, but the earth just keeps going forever.

verses.kjv: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.
verses.ct: The sun comes up and the sun goes down, then rushes back to the place where it rises again.

verses.kjv: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.
verses.ct: The wind blows south, then swings around to the north. It spins around and around, always circling back on its same path.

verses.kjv: All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; unto the place from whence the rivers come, thither they return again.
verses.ct: Every river flows into the ocean, yet the ocean never overflows. The water returns to where the rivers began, and the cycle starts over.

verses.kjv: All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.
verses.ct: Everything is wearisome — more than anyone can express. The eye never gets enough of seeing, and the ear never gets enough of hearing.

verses.kjv: The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.
verses.ct: Whatever has already happened is what will happen again. Whatever has already been done is what will be done again. There is nothing new under the sun.

verses.kjv: Is there any thing whereof it may be said, See, this is new? it hath been already of old time, which was before us.
verses.ct: Can anyone point to something and say, "Look, this is new"? It already existed long ago, in the ages before us.

verses.kjv: There is no remembrance of former things; neither shall there be any remembrance of things that are to come with those that shall come after.
verses.ct: No one remembers the people of the past, and future generations won't be remembered either by those who come after them.

verses.kjv: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: I, the Teacher, served as king over Israel in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.
verses.ct: I dedicated myself to studying and exploring through wisdom everything that happens under heaven. This is a heavy burden that God has placed on human beings to struggle with.

verses.kjv: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
verses.ct: I have observed everything that is done under the sun, and look — it is all meaningless, like chasing after the wind.

verses.kjv: That which is crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.
verses.ct: What is twisted cannot be straightened, and what is missing cannot be counted.

verses.kjv: I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yea, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.ct: I said to myself, "I have achieved greatness and accumulated more wisdom than anyone who ruled Jerusalem before me. My mind has taken in an enormous amount of wisdom and knowledge."

verses.kjv: And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.
verses.ct: So I devoted myself to understanding wisdom, and also to understanding foolishness and stupidity. But I realized that this too is like chasing after the wind.

verses.kjv: For in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.
verses.ct: Because the more wisdom you gain, the more grief you experience, and the more knowledge you acquire, the more sorrow increases.
